definition: MURAKAMI Haruki (1949-), Japanese novelist and translator
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)

sentences.english: Murakami haruki is currently a very famous author in Japan.
sentences.chinese: 村上春樹是日本當代著名作家。

sentences.english: His wife, Yoko Takahashi, is his first reader.
sentences.chinese: 村上春樹的妻子高橋洋子是他的第一個讀者。

sentences.english: The first production is an interactive EP, a soundtrack of Haruki Murakami.
sentences.chinese: 首張作品《樹音》爲村上春樹的原聲配樂。

sentences.english: He likes Haruki Murakami , I also liked detective story, the logic in the book.
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡村上春樹，也喜歡推理小說，具有邏輯性的書。

sentences.english: Murakami Haruki' s novels possess both the characteristics of the popular literature and the scholastic literature.
sentences.chinese: 村上春樹的小說兼具大衆文學與精英文學的特點。

sentences.english: By Haruki Murakami. This guy is such an imaginative writer.
sentences.chinese: 作者村上春樹，他是一位充滿想象力的作家。

sentences.english: The writing of Haruki Murakami is affected deeply by modern and contemporary literature of the west.
sentences.chinese: 村上春樹的創作，明顯受到了西方現當代文學的影響。

sentences.english: Murakami was a late bloomer, writing his first work at age 29.
sentences.chinese: 村上春樹大器晚成，29歲才寫他的第一部作品。

sentences.english: His father died two years ago, his mother is still alive.
sentences.chinese: 村上春樹的父親兩年前去世了，母親還健在。

definition: serialized/published as a serial (in a newspaper)
to keep a record of events/record/to start to form memories (after one's infancy)

pinyin: Nuo4 bei4 er3 Wen2 xue2 Jiang3

definition: Diary of a Madman by Lu Xun 魯迅|鲁迅[Lu3 Xun4]
Tokyo, capital of Japan/Tonkin (northern Vietnam during the French colonial period)
